text: It's a fundamental, social attitude that the 1% supports symphonies and operas and doesn't support Johnny learning to program hip-hop beats. When I put it like that, it sounds like, 'Well, yeah,' but you start to think, 'Why not, though?' What makes one more valuable than another?
author: David Byrne

text: I think people feel threatened by homosexuality. The problem isn't about gay people, the problem is about the attitude towards gay people. People think that all gays are Hannibal Lecters. But gay people are sons and daughters, politicians and doctors, American heroes and daughters of American heroes.
author: Hollis Stacy

text: I have this theory that, depending on your attitude, your life doesn't have to become this ridiculous charade that it seems so many people end up living.
author: Christian Bale

text: It was just like a dream. I could have ended up with an album that's not all that different from anything else coming out of Nashville. Mutt made the difference. He took these songs, my attitude, my creativity, and colored them in a way that is unique.
author: Shania Twain

text: I look at Jagger and the like and if I see a good attitude I'll admire it but I wouldn't copy their style.
author: Michael Hutchence

text: My attitude is never to be satisfied, never enough, never.
author: Duke Ellington

text: Today's youth are told to get rich or die trying and they really shouldn't take that attitude forward with them.
author: Kareem Abdul-Jabbar

text: The purely agitational attitude is not good enough for a detailed consideration of a subject.
author: Jawaharlal Nehru

text: Not every religion has to have St. Augustine's attitude to sex. Why even in our culture marriages are celebrated in a church, everyone present knows what is going to happen that night, but that doesn't prevent it being a religious ceremony.
author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

text: Never refuse an assignment except when there is a conflict of interest, a potential of danger to you or your family, or you hold a strongly biased attitude about the subject under focus.
author: Jessica Savitch

text: We can revolutionize the attitude of inner city brown and black kids to learning. We need a civil rights movement within the African-American community.
author: Henry Louis Gates

text: It's a question of keeping one's eyes and ears open and watching how other people play the game. They're watching me too, to see what my attitude is like.
author: Charles Dance

text: Yes, we're still five little people with a noisy attitude.
author: Angus Young

text: In individual industries where female labour pays an important role, any movement advocating better wages, shorter working hours, etc., would not be doomed from the start because of the attitude of those women workers who are not organized.
author: Clara Zetkin

text: On 'Van Halen,' I was a young punk, and everything revolved around the fastest kid in town, gunslinger attitude. But I'd say that at the time of 'Fair Warning,' I started concentrating more on songwriting. But I guess in most people's minds I'm just a gunslinger.
author: Eddie Van Halen

text: Design is about point of view, and there should be some sort of woman or lifestyle or attitude in one's head as a designer.
author: Vera Wang

text: Liberalism is an attitude rather than a set of dogmas - an attitude that insists upon questioning all plausible and self-evident propositions, seeking not to reject them but to find out what evidence there is to support them rather than their possible alternatives.
author: Morris Raphael Cohen

text: The Dolls were an attitude. If nothing else they were a great attitude.
author: Johnny Thunders

text: I was impressed by Hendrix. His attitude was brilliant. Even the way he walked was amazing.
author: Ritchie Blackmore

text: The best way to inspire people to superior performance is to convince them by everything you do and by your everyday attitude that you are wholeheartedly supporting them.
author: Harold S. Geneen

text: I think it's your mental attitude. So many of us start dreading age in high school and that's a waste of a lovely life. 'Oh... I'm 30, oh, I'm 40, oh, 50.' Make the most of it.
author: Betty White

text: The attitude that nature is chaotic and that the artist puts order into it is a very absurd point of view, I think. All that we can hope for is to put some order into ourselves.
author: Willem de Kooning

text: Britishness is just a way of putting things together and a certain don't care attitude about clothes. You don't care, you just do it and it looks great.
author: Vivienne Westwood

text: It remains to consider what attitude thoughtful men and Christian believers should take respecting them, and how they stand related to beliefs of another order.
author: Asa Gray

text: Surfers have the most attitude.
author: Shaun White

text: I've never run into a guy who could win at the top level in anything today and didn't have the right attitude, didn't give it everything he had, at least while he was doing it wasn't prepared and didn't have the whole program worked out.
author: Ted Turner

text: That's what I love from metal, and that's what I love from hip-hop. That's what I love from any music that's hard, that's got an edge to it-The attitude in it.

text: That attitude that fighting is probably not fair, but you have to defend yourself anyway and damage the enemy, has been profoundly consequential as far as my political activism goes.
author: June Jordan

text: Seek out that particular mental attribute which makes you feel most deeply and vitally alive, along with which comes the inner voice which says, 'This is the real me,' and when you have found that attitude, follow it.
author: James Truslow Adams

text: People think, 'She's a model. She must have such an attitude. She must be so stuck up.' But I'm normal. I cry. I'm not rich. I drive a 1987 Chevrolet Celebrity.
author: Summer Altice

text: My grandfather was a man, when he talked about freedom, his attitude was really interesting. His view was that you had obligations or you had responsibilities, and when you fulfilled those obligations or responsibilities, that then gave you the liberty to do other things.
author: Clarence Thomas

text: I think failure is nothing more than life's way of nudging you that you are off course. My attitude to failure is not attached to outcome, but in not trying. It is liberating. Most people attach failure to something not working out or how people perceive you. This way, it is about answering to yourself.
author: Sara Blakely

text: Part of our western outlook stems from the scientific attitude and its method of isolating the parts of a phenomenon in order to analyze them.
author: Arthur Erickson

text: There is a single thread of attitude, a single direction of flow, that joins our present time to its early burgeoning in Mediterranean civilization.
author: Arthur Erickson

text: We live in a country that used to have a can-do attitude, and now we have a 'what-can-you-do-for-me?' attitude, and what I try to do is find ways that we can develop common ground.
author: Benjamin Carson

text: Could we change our attitude, we should not only see life differently, but life itself would come to be different.
author: Katherine Mansfield

text: The ideal attitude is to be physically loose and mentally tight.
author: Arthur Ashe

text: An attitude to life which seeks fulfillment in the single-minded pursuit of wealth - in short, materialism - does not fit into this world, because it contains within itself no limiting principle, while the environment in which it is placed is strictly limited.
author: E. F. Schumacher

text: You may not be able to change a situation, but with humor you can change your attitude about it.
author: Allen Klein

text: What was past was past. I suppose that was the general attitude.
author: V. S. Naipaul

text: Iraq is just a symbol of the attitude of western democracies to the rest of the world.
author: Harold Pinter

text: I don't mean this in a stuck-up way, but I needed an attitude song.
author: Gwen Stefani

text: I met my grandfather just before he died, and it was the first time that I had seen Dad with a relative of his. It was interesting to see my own father as a son and the body language and alteration in attitude that comes with that, and it sort of changed our relationship for the better.
author: Christian Bale

text: I don't think it's a good attitude in your life to feel that you have to be rich to have self-esteem.
author: Tom Petty

text: All we need, really, is a change from a near frigid to a tropical attitude of mind.
author: Marjory Stoneman Douglas

text: An aristocratic culture does not advertise its emotions. In its forms of expression it is sober and reserved. Its general attitude is stoic.
author: Johan Huizinga

text: I was impressed by Hendrix. Not so much by his playing, as his attitude - he wasn't a great player, but everything else about him was brilliant.
author: Ritchie Blackmore

text: Attitude is attitude, whether you're a West Coast gangster or East Coast gangster, you know?
author: Paul Walker

text: You know, I always say white is not a colour, white is an attitude, and if you haven't got trillions of dollars in the bank that you don't need, you can't be white.
author: Dick Gregory

text: Being a part of SKECHERS is exciting. It is such a hip company with a great attitude and image.

text: It is precisely the purpose of the public opinion generated by the press to make the public incapable of judging, to insinuate into it the attitude of someone irresponsible, uninformed.
author: Walter Benjamin

text: Coaches will eventually notice a great attitude, and they respect that.
author: Heather O'Reilly

text: The novelist teaches the reader to comprehend the world as a question. There is wisdom and tolerance in that attitude. In a world built on sacrosanct certainties the novel is dead.
author: Milan Kundera

text: No one's going to be able to operate without a grounding in the basic sciences. Language would be helpful, although English is becoming increasingly international. And travel. You have to have a global attitude.
author: Rupert Murdoch

text: My second husband believed I had such a fickle attitude to friendship that each Friday he would update the list of my 'Top Ten' friends in the manner of a Top Of The Pops chart countdown.
author: Julie Burchill

text: If you can kill animals, the same attitude can kill human beings. The mentality is the same which exploits nature and which creates wars.

text: My attitude is, do as much as I can while I'm free. And if I'm arrested I'll still do as much as I can.

text: There are a lot of movies I'd like to throw away. That's not to say that I went in with that attitude. Any film I ever started, I went in with all the hope and best intentions in the world, but some films just don't work.
author: Kiefer Sutherland

text: By making a comeback, I'm changing the attitude of people toward me. If I'd known that people would react so enthusiastically, I'd have done it years ago.
author: Mark Spitz

text: Today, I think the attitude is that governing is not necessarily good politics, and the result is that it's much more partisan and much more divided.
author: Leon Panetta

text: That term's definitely got a negative aura to it, because people think a diva is somebody with an attitude who demands things all the time. Of course there is that type of diva, but my idea of a diva has always been a singer - whether male or female - who gets on that stage and captivates you with their presence and their voice.
author: Jordin Sparks

text: Oh, I don't think Tom Sowell would tell anybody to join the administration. That's not his style. But I think his attitude has always been if it had to be done he'd prefer me to do it than somebody else.
author: Clarence Thomas

text: The Senator from Massachusetts has given us ample grounds to doubt the judgment and the attitude he brings to bear on vital issues of national security.
author: Dick Cheney

text: I perfectly understood President Obama's attitude throughout the French presidential campaign. He had no reason to distance himself from Nicolas Sarkozy. It's the basic solidarity that leaders who worked together owe to each other.
author: Francois Hollande

text: I think it has something to do with being British. We don't take ourselves as seriously as some other countries do. I think a lot of people take themselves far too seriously I find that a very tedious attitude.
author: Joan Collins

text: I failed the LSAT. Basically, if I had not failed, I'd have been a lawyer and there would be no Spanx. I think failure is nothing more than life's way of nudging you that you are off course. My attitude to failure is not attached to outcome, but in not trying. It is liberating.
author: Sara Blakely

text: My attitude to writing is like when you do wallpapering, you remember where all the little bits are that don't meet. And then your friends say: It's terrific!
author: Harrison Birtwistle

text: Liberalism is a really old British tradition and it has a completely different attitude towards the individual and the relationship between the individual and the state than the collectivist response of Labour, and particularly Old Labour, does.

text: I've always had a 'Work hard, play hard' attitude to life - I still do - but sometimes you get involved in something that needs a calm, methodical approach.
author: Damian Lewis

text: I've always considered myself to be fiercely patriotic. I love Britain - its history and the down-to-earth attitude people have.
author: Gary Numan

text: There is a brief moment when all there is in a man's mind and soul and spirit is reflected through his eyes, his hands, his attitude. This is the moment to record.

text: I was fortunate to play for Pete Rose and have teammates like Ken Griffey Sr., Tony Perez and Dave Concepcion. I grew up in the game with a mature attitude. I've always known it was better to be seen and not heard.
author: Eric Davis

text: I've never been out with any of the cast of Coronation Street. We're all very close friends so it's very much a professional attitude.
author: Richard Fleeshman

text: Nothing. We're all friends and friendly. So when the cameras go down, depending on the mood or the nature of the material we're dealing with, there's usually a kind of a prevailing light attitude that's floating around.
author: Richard Dean Anderson

text: I will keep smiling, be positive and never give up! I will give 100 percent each time I play. These are always my goals and my attitude.
author: Yani Tseng

text: I'm taking a bit of a wait-and-see attitude towards 3D.
author: Christopher Nolan

text: My father instilled in me the attitude of prevailing. If there's a challenge, go for it. If there's a wall to break down, break it down.
author: Donny Osmond

text: Just as the left has to be more willing to question 'Government knows best,' the right has to rethink its laissez-faire attitude toward government.
author: Jack Kemp

text: The attitude of insolent haughtiness is characteristic of the relationships Americans form with what is alien to them, with others.
author: Jose Saramago

text: Although as a sailor I despised politics - for I loved my sailor's life and still love it today - conditions forced me to take up a definite attitude towards political problems.
author: Fritz Sauckel

text: How do you nurture a positive attitude when all the statistics say you're a dead man? You go to work.

text: The pilot looked at his cues of attitude and speed and orientation and so on and responded as he would from the same cues in an airplane, but there was no way it flew the same. The simulators had showed us that.

text: It was my father who instilled the 'never say no' attitude I carry around with me today, and who instilled in me a sense of wonder, always taking us on adventures in the car, never telling us the destination.

text: I went to England in the '70s, and I was in my early 20s. There was still a residue of that era of being an underclass or colonial. I assume it must have been a more aggressive and prominent attitude 40 years before that, because Australia internationally wasn't regarded as having much cultural value. We were a country full of sheep and convicts.
author: Geoffrey Rush

text: For a writer only one form of patriotism exists: his attitude toward language.
author: Joseph Brodsky

text: Gardening is not trivial. If you believe that it is, closely examine why you feel that way. You may discover that this attitude has been forced upon you by mass media and the crass culture it creates and maintains. The fact is, gardening is just the opposite - it is, or should be, a central, basic expression of human life.
author: Andrew Weil

text: Becoming an author changes your attitude too. Once you see where books come from, and how they're made, they never seem quite as sacred again.
author: Lev Grossman

text: I was bringing my attitude as a regular person 'cause this is my attitude.
author: Glenn Danzig

text: If you can attribute your success entirely to your own mental effort, to your own attitude, to some spiritual essence that you have that is better than other people's, then that must feel pretty good.
author: Barbara Ehrenreich

text: I fell in love with Erica Kane the summer before my freshman year of high school. Like all red-blooded teen American boys, I'd come home from water polo practice and eat a box of Entenmann's Pop'Ems donut holes in front of the TV while obsessively fawning over 'All My Children' and Erica, her clothes, and her narcissistic attitude.
author: Andy Cohen

text: Films for TV have to be much closer to the book, mainly because the objective with a TV movie that translates literature is to get the audience, after seeing this version, to pick up the book and read it themselves. My attitude is that TV can never really be any form of art, because it serves audience expectations.
author: Michael Haneke

text: You can't beat the beehive for glam punkette attitude.
author: Rob Sheffield

text: I haven't seen Clones, which has been during this period when I haven't seen much of anything, but I did see Phantom Menace, and see my feelings about it - see, first of all, I think that when you make a lot of movies, your attitude about the movies changes.
author: Lawrence Kasdan

text: My attitude is always one of sensuality, aggressive enthusiasm and a kind of outrageousness in my expression.
author: Sally Kirkland

text: Epic poetry exhibits life in some great symbolic attitude. It cannot strictly be said to symbolize life itself, but always some manner of life.
author: Lascelles Abercrombie

text: When you retire, it's a place in life, a part of the journey. You just don't quit work you develop an attitude where you can do what you please.
author: Tom T. Hall

text: When a parent shows up with an attitude of entitlement, understand that under it is a boatload of anxiety.
author: Robert Evans

text: What reader wants to be told what attitude to strike?

text: My denial and irresponsible attitude about asthma put me at great risk and caused me so much needless suffering. My hope is that the kids I talk to learn to open up about their asthma, become educated about their condition, and seek help.
author: Jackie Joyner-Kersee

text: Woman must have her freedom, the fundamental freedom of choosing whether or not she will be a mother and how many children she will have. Regardless of what man's attitude may be, that problem is hers - and before it can be his, it is hers alone.
author: Margaret Sanger

text: Even as a little child, I've always had that comedian kind of attitude.
author: Etta James

text: I mean, the shoe - there is a music to it, there is attitude, there is sound, it's a movement. Clothes - it's a different story. There are a million things I'd rather do before designing clothes: directing, landscaping.
author: Christian Louboutin

text: In just the same way the thousands of successive positions of a runner are contracted into one sole symbolic attitude, which our eye perceives, which art reproduces, and which becomes for everyone the image of a man who runs.
author: Henri Bergson

text: In the late '70s, maybe just before I started, there was still an attitude that if you did film you didn't do TV and vice versa, but that's gone now.
author: Robert Carlyle

text: I cannot say that the attitude of the United Nations always is for the Israeli attitude. Israel, I think, has been under severe attacks by members of the United Nations many times.
author: Ariel Sharon

text: I love her attitude, but as much as I'd like to bring my medals to a speech or appearance, I never do.
author: Mary Lou Retton

text: We must advertise to U.S. business that we are there, that our attitude has changed, and that we care. When we are asked to help, we have to perform and provide the right advice.
author: Lawrence Eagleburger

text: The American attitude towards efficiency and execution should always underlie architecture.
author: Helmut Jahn

text: I have such an extreme attitude about work, where I can just completely be derelict of my responsibilities and then when I am not derelict, I am completely indulged in it. I swing pretty wildly from the two extremes.

text: I have a political attitude, but I'm certainly not a politician.
author: Kgalema Motlanthe

text: I think my attitude to human beings has changed since leaving prison.
author: Jeffrey Archer

text: I went to the Performing Arts School and studied classical ballet. That attitude is something that's put into your head. You are never thin enough.
author: Carmen Electra

text: I have always detested any departure from reality, an attitude which I relate to my mother's poor mental health.
author: Jean Piaget

text: With just about every player in Australia, his whole goal and ambition is to play for Australia. That's why they're playing first class cricket. It's just a different attitude.
author: Shane Warne

text: Right after 'Raymond' I had a world-is-my-oyster attitude, but I found out I don't like oysters. I had this existential emptiness. 'What is my purpose? Who am I?' I had a big identity crisis.
author: Ray Romano

text: What sculptors do is represent the essence of gesture. What is important in mime is attitude.
author: Marcel Marceau

text: It really was hand-to-mouth and you can say, 'Poor little me, how dreadful, what a deprived childhood', but I didn't feel that way at all. It's all about the attitude at home.
author: Carol Vorderman

text: Having a clear faith, based on the creed of the church is often labeled today as fundamentalism. Whereas relativism, which is letting oneself be tossed and swept along by every wind of teaching, look like the only attitude acceptable to today's standards.
author: Joseph Ratzinger

text: You know what's funny to me? Attitude.
author: Don Rickles

text: The characteristic political attitude of today is not one of positive belief, but of despair.
author: Herbert Read

text: If you can't change your fate, change your attitude.
author: Charles Revson

text: Mainly what I learned from Buddy... was an attitude. He loved music, and he taught me that it shouldn't have any barriers to it.
author: Waylon Jennings

text: I think fun is an important part of the entertainment industry, and it should be. Anybody who's not incorporating some of that into their work needs to take a break, go away, and have an attitude adjustment.
author: Diane Lane

text: I have played on many teams throughout my career, and I know when a team has the tools, and the right positive attitude towards winning.
author: Boomer Esiason

text: Vampires are so old that they don't need to impress anyone anymore. They're comfortable in their own skin. It's this enigmatic strength that's very romantic and old-fashioned. I think it goes back to something of a Victorian attitude of finding a strong man who's going to look after his woman.
author: Stephen Moyer

text: What I wish I had, is that I wish I was a little more Greek, in that I wish I could lose my North American driven attitude and that I could be a little bit more poetic and laissez faire.
author: Nia Vardalos

text: I was always the guy getting kicked out of my classes at school for having an attitude problem.
author: Chevy Chase

text: And I tell you, having girls has made me a much better man. I have friends who are fathers, but they only have boys, and they have the same attitude toward women they always had, you know? And I don't play that... My girls, you mess with them? I will bury you underground.
author: Mark Wahlberg

text: Style is a reflection of your attitude and your personality.
author: Shawn Ashmore

text: If a person can be said to have the wrong attitude, there is no need to pay attention to his arguments.
author: John McCarthy

text: The attitude is we live and let live. This is actually an amazing change in values in a rather short time and it's an example of freedom from religion.
author: Tom Wolfe

text: Not to discriminate every moment some passionate attitude in those about us, and in the very brilliancy of their gifts some tragic dividing on their ways, is, on this short day of frost and sun, to sleep before evening.
author: Walter Pater

text: Players should know that if you can't make the contribution of the winning shot, that your attitude every day when you come to practice, or the positive contribution you make through cheering and keeping up team morale, is just as important in the overall picture.
author: Sue Wicks

text: It's not the style that motivates me, as much as an attitude of openness that I have when I go into a project.
author: Herbie Hancock

text: The place of chess in the society is closely related to the attitude of young people towards our game.
author: Boris Spassky

text: We assume that we've come so far as compassionate citizens of the world if we do choose to read the news, yet the attitude towards life can be one where we put blinders on and forget that there are civil wars going on. It's easy to forget that there are so many people starving to death every single day.
author: Anne Hathaway

text: The jokes are great but what really matters for a comedian is his performance, his whole attitude, and the laughs that he gets between the jokes rather than on top of the jokes.
author: Jack Dee

text: There were a few teachers who just did not like me because of my face. Once, I was told to stand in the corner until I cheered up. The attitude was, 'Oh, for God's sake, what's the matter with him?' But it's just a natural expression.
author: Jack Dee

text: I'm just part of a tradition of people who aren't pleased. I would never think anyone else who has the same attitude was getting it from me. I'd just think they're... sensible.
author: Jack Dee

text: The key to life is your attitude. Whether you're single or married or have kids or don't have kids, it's how you look at your life, what you make of it. It's about making the best of your life wherever you are in life.
author: Candace Bushnell

text: If you get a diagnosis, get on a therapy, keep a good attitude and keep your sense of humor.
author: Teri Garr

text: When a woman puts on a heel, she has a different posture, a different attitude. She really stands up and has a consciousness of her body.
author: Christian Louboutin

text: Whenever I'm having a bad day and have an attitude, I stay home. I keep it at home.
author: Michael Clarke Duncan

text: You don't have to have an attitude if you're famous.
author: Adriana Lima

text: I need that aggressive attitude to play my music and more men have that attitude than women.
author: Lita Ford

text: But Jesus changes your attitude towards yourself and towards other people.
author: Cliff Richard

text: But I think bands that rolled in with a big attitude, like they were some big deal, I just found that very strange.
author: Rob Zombie

text: What irritates me is the bland way people go around saying, 'Oh, our attitude has changed. We don't dislike these people any more.' But by the strangest coincidence, they haven't taken away the injustice the laws are still on the books.
author: Christopher Isherwood

text: There is definitely something sexy about a girl with an attitude and a pair of leather pants.
author: Eliza Dushku

text: The phenomenon of home schooling is a wonderful example of the American can-do attitude. Growing numbers of parents have become disenchanted with government-run public schools. Many parents have simply taken matters into their own hands, literally.
author: Steve Forbes

text: Regardless of what one's attitude towards prohibition may be, temperance is something against which, at a time of war, no reasonable protest can be made.
author: William Lyon Mackenzie King

text: At home in Ireland, there's a habit of avoidance, an ironical attitude towards the authority figure.
author: Seamus Heaney

text: Even if people do wrong, we're social animals, so what can we do about stopping them doing the same things in future? Saying people are 'bad' or 'evil' is just an unwillingness to engage an unwillingness to try to empathise. That sanctimonious attitude doesn't help anyone.
author: Denise Mina

text: People have often asked if I'm gay because I don't go out of my way to spit and scratch and give people attitude.
author: Jason Bateman

text: I don't return anybody's calls unless it's going to mean extra money for me. And I've completely cut off all relationships with any friends that I had before the show. And I've copped an attitude.
author: Mike Judge

text: A positive attitude is something everyone can work on, and everyone can learn how to employ it.
author: Joan Lunden

text: My feelings about my mortality are less selfish than they used to be. I used to affect a cavalier attitude to death now I see it from my son's perspective.
author: Rufus Sewell

text: The U.S. tries to provide immigrants who grow up here with a world-class education and imbue them with the can-do attitude that has long defined American innovation.
author: Gary Locke

text: The attitude of independence toward a constructed language which all national speakers must adopt is really a great advantage, because it tends to make man see himself as the master of language instead of its obedient servant.
author: Edward Sapir

text: I feel like I have as good a shot as anybody out there and I have gotten close in the past, so why not have the attitude that I can come out and play great tennis and maybe even win this tournament.
author: Michael Chang

text: Art is the child of Nature yes, her darling child, in whom we trace the features of the mother's face, her aspect and her attitude.
author: Beck

text: I just think that people take me a little more seriously as a brunette. I don't know if that's just because of a societal preconceived notion that all blondes are stupid, but it's a different kind of attitude.
author: Kate Bosworth

text: I came back to performing with a different attitude about performing and myself. I wasn't expecting perfection any more, just hoping for an occasional inspiration.
author: Neil Diamond

text: The purely agitation attitude is not good enough for a detailed consideration of a subject.
author: Michael Korda

text: Animals have a much better attitude to life and death than we do. They know when their time has come. We are the ones that suffer when they pass, but it's a healing kind of grief that enables us to deal with other griefs that are not so easy to grab hold of.
author: Emmylou Harris

text: Only one thing can conquer war - that attitude of mind which can see nothing in war but destruction and annihilation.
author: Ludwig von Mises

text: It's not too good to have this attitude in F1. It could be a disadvantage.
author: Alain Prost

text: I just really think every job I do, I get this gypsy attitude to money.
author: Jessica Brown Findlay

text: My personal view is that such total planning by the state is an absolute good and not simply a relative good... I do not myself think of the attitude I take as deriving from Marx - though this undoubtedly will be suggested - but from Fichte and Hegel.
author: John Grierson

text: There's a punk-rock attitude, clearly, to 'Hated.' There's even a punk-rock attitude to 'The Hangover,' I think. We start the movie with a Glenn Danzig song.
author: Todd Phillips

text: The American attitude is 'We're the best'. That's why the NBA guys who come from other countries, the Europeans, all sort of stick together away from the game.
author: Andrew Bogut

text: The problem was just a mean attitude that festers and has to be challenged.
author: Major Owens

text: I'm not anti-fashion, but I've always had a bit of a punk attitude. That's important, I think. I do my own thing.
author: Sade Adu

text: To so enter into it in nature and art that the enjoyed meanings of life may become a part of living is the attitude of aesthetic appreciation.

author: Gene Barry

text: I can't believe the pro-choicers attitude toward unborn children-to me it's the ultimate liberal cause, to defend those without a voice.
author: Michael Aston

text: An attitude of philosophic doubt, of suspended judgment, is repugnant to the natural man. Belief is an independent joy to him.
author: William Minto

text: Even when I'm playing someone named Fat Amy, I'm all about confidence and attitude.
author: Rebel Wilson

text: Everything has beauty, but not everyone sees it.
author: Confucius

text: To love beauty is to see light.
author: Victor Hugo

text: Beauty is only skin deep. If you go after someone just because she's beautiful but don't have anything to talk about, it's going to get boring fast. You want to look beyond the surface and see if you can have fun or if you have anything in common with this person.

text: A woman whose smile is open and whose expression is glad has a kind of beauty no matter what she wears.
author: Anne Roiphe

text: People are like stained - glass windows. They sparkle and shine when the sun is out, but when the darkness sets in, their true beauty is revealed only if there is a light from within.
author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross

text: The pursuit of truth and beauty is a sphere of activity in which we are permitted to remain children all our lives.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Of life's two chief prizes, beauty and truth, I found the first in a loving heart and the second in a laborer's hand.
author: Khalil Gibran

text: Love of beauty is taste. The creation of beauty is art.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Life is full of beauty. Notice it. Notice the bumble bee, the small child, and the smiling faces. Smell the rain, and feel the wind. Live your life to the fullest potential, and fight for your dreams.

text: A thing of beauty is a joy forever: its loveliness increases it will never pass into nothingness.
author: John Keats

text: Beauty is eternity gazing at itself in a mirror.
author: Khalil Gibran

text: A beauty is a woman you notice a charmer is one who notices you.
author: Adlai E. Stevenson

text: The soul that sees beauty may sometimes walk alone.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: Flowers... are a proud assertion that a ray of beauty outvalues all the utilities of the world.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: She got her looks from her father. He's a plastic surgeon.
author: Groucho Marx

text: Beauty and folly are old companions.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Rare is the union of beauty and purity.
author: Juvenal

text: Personal beauty is a greater recommendation than any letter of reference.
author: Aristotle

text: Beauty is unbearable, drives us to despair, offering us for a minute the glimpse of an eternity that we should like to stretch out over the whole of time.
author: Albert Camus

text: The world's biggest power is the youth and beauty of a woman.
author: Chanakya

text: Beauty awakens the soul to act.
author: Dante Alighieri

text: A witty woman is a treasure a witty beauty is a power.
author: George Meredith

text: Think of all the beauty still left around you and be happy.
author: Anne Frank

text: Beauty is a manifestation of secret natural laws, which otherwise would have been hidden from us forever.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: Beauty is all very well at first sight but who ever looks at it when it has been in the house three days?
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: Beauty has a lot to do with character.
author: Kevyn Aucoin

text: There is no definition of beauty, but when you can see someone's spirit coming through, something unexplainable, that's beautiful to me.
author: Liv Tyler

text: For me the greatest beauty always lies in the greatest clarity.
author: Gotthold Ephraim Lessing

text: Since love grows within you, so beauty grows. For love is the beauty of the soul.
author: Saint Augustine

text: I define nothing. Not beauty, not patriotism. I take each thing as it is, without prior rules about what it should be.
author: Bob Dylan

text: Beauty is worse than wine, it intoxicates both the holder and beholder.
author: Aldous Huxley

text: Beauty in things exists in the mind which contemplates them.
author: David Hume

text: I do not have much patience with a thing of beauty that must be explained to be understood. If it does need additional interpretation by someone other than the creator, then I question whether it has fulfilled its purpose.
author: Charlie Chaplin

text: I don't think of all the misery but of the beauty that still remains.
author: Anne Frank

text: Beauty is not caused. It is.
author: Emily Dickinson

text: Beauty is truth's smile when she beholds her own face in a perfect mirror.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

text: Beauty is everywhere a welcome guest.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: It is amazing how complete is the delusion that beauty is goodness.
author: Leo Tolstoy

text: A mode of conduct, a standard of courage, discipline, fortitude and integrity can do a great deal to make a woman beautiful.
author: Jacqueline Bisset

text: Beauty, n: the power by which a woman charms a lover and terrifies a husband.
author: Ambrose Bierce

text: Dear God! how beauty varies in nature and art. In a woman the flesh must be like marble in a statue the marble must be like flesh.
author: Victor Hugo

text: Beauty doesn't need ornaments. Softness can't bear the weight of ornaments.
author: Munshi Premchand

text: Beauty is in the heart of the beholder.
author: H. G. Wells

text: Let us live for the beauty of our own reality.
author: Charles Lamb

text: Every year of my life I grow more convinced that it is wisest and best to fix our attention on the beautiful and the good, and dwell as little as possible on the evil and the false.

text: Beauty is the promise of happiness.
author: Edmund Burke

text: We live in a wonderful world that is full of beauty, charm and adventure. There is no end to the adventures that we can have if only we seek them with our eyes open.
author: Jawaharlal Nehru

text: Imagination disposes of everything it creates beauty, justice, and happiness, which are everything in this world.
author: Blaise Pascal

text: A women's greatest asset is her beauty.
author: Alex Comfort

text: Beauty is indeed a good gift of God but that the good may not think it a great good, God dispenses it even to the wicked.
author: Saint Augustine

text: Beauty is power a smile is its sword.
author: John Ray

text: Beauty itself is but the sensible image of the Infinite.
author: Francis Bacon

text: Beauty is ever to the lonely mind a shadow fleeting she is never plain. She is a visitor who leaves behind the gift of grief, the souvenir of pain.
author: Christopher Morley

text: Beauty is only temporary, but your mind lasts you a lifetime.
author: Alicia Machado

text: Beauty is a fragile gift.
author: Ovid

text: Beauty saves. Beauty heals. Beauty motivates. Beauty unites. Beauty returns us to our origins, and here lies the ultimate act of saving, of healing, of overcoming dualism.
author: Matthew Fox

text: In every man's heart there is a secret nerve that answers to the vibrations of beauty.
author: Christopher Morley

text: Love built on beauty, soon as beauty, dies.
author: John Donne

text: I don't need plastic in my body to validate me as a woman.
author: Courtney Love

text: I gave my beauty and my youth to men. I am going to give my wisdom and experience to animals.

text: The problem with beauty is that it's like being born rich and getting poorer.

text: In youth and beauty, wisdom is but rare!
author: Homer

text: Heat cannot be separated from fire, or beauty from The Eternal.
author: Dante Alighieri

text: Having inner beauty is something you develop on your own, and I like to think I have that.
author: Cindy Margolis

text: Beauty is less important than quality.
author: Eugene Ormandy

text: There is a kind of beauty in imperfection.
author: Conrad Hall

text: When virtue and modesty enlighten her charms, the lustre of a beautiful woman is brighter than the stars of heaven, and the influence of her power it is in vain to resist.
author: Akhenaton

text: Beauty is variable, ugliness is constant.
author: Douglas Horton

text: 'Handsome' means many things to many people. If people consider me handsome, I feel flattered - and have my parents to thank for it. Realistically, it doesn't hurt to be good-looking, especially in this business.
author: Richard Chamberlain

text: My mother always called me an ugly weed, so I never was aware of anything until I was older. Plain girls should have someone telling them they are beautiful. Sometimes this works miracles.
author: Hedy Lamarr

text: Zest is the secret of all beauty. There is no beauty that is attractive without zest.
author: Christian Dior

text: Beauty is whatever gives joy.
author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

text: There is no personal achievement in being born beautiful.
author: Loretta Young

text: The love of beauty in its multiple forms is the noblest gift of the human cerebrum.
author: Alexis Carrel

text: Beauty is the first present nature gives to women and the first it takes away.
author: Fay Weldon

text: Some guys say beauty is only skin deep. But when you walk into a party, you don't see somebody's brain. The initial contact has to be the sniffing.

text: We are learning, too, that the love of beauty is one of Nature's greatest healers.
author: Ellsworth Huntington

text: I sincerely feel that beauty largely comes from within.
author: Christy Turlington

text: There is no cosmetic for beauty like happiness.
author: Maria Mitchell

text: Even in the centuries which appear to us to be the most monstrous and foolish, the immortal appetite for beauty has always found satisfaction.
author: Charles Baudelaire

text: You can only perceive real beauty in a person as they get older.
author: Anouk Aimee

text: Inner beauty should be the most important part of improving one's self.
author: Priscilla Presley

text: What beauty is, I know not, though it adheres to many things.
author: Albrecht Durer

text: Though beauty gives you a weird sense of entitlement, it's rather frightening and threatening to have others ascribe such importance to something you know you're just renting for a while.
author: Candice Bergen

text: Things are beautiful if you love them.
author: Jean Anouilh

text: The real sin against life is to abuse and destroy beauty, even one's own even more, one's own, for that has been put in our care and we are responsible for its well-being.
author: Katherine Anne Porter

text: Real beauty knocks you a little bit off kilter.
author: David Byrne

text: Integrity reveals beauty.
author: Thomas Leonard

text: If you get simple beauty and naught else, you get about the best thing God invents.
author: Robert Browning

text: Goodness is beauty in the best estate.
author: Christopher Marlowe

text: Our hearts were drunk with a beauty Our eyes could never see.
author: George William Russell

text: Like charity, I believe glamour should begin at home.
author: Loretta Young

text: How goodness heightens beauty!
author: Milan Kundera

text: Because beauty isn't enough, there must be something more.
author: Eva Herzigova

text: Taking joy in living is a woman's best cosmetic.
author: Rosalind Russell

text: Without realizing it, the individual composes his life according to the laws of beauty even in times of greatest distress.

text: Beauty is one of the rare things which does not lead to doubt of God.
author: Jean Anouilh

text: I'd like to grow up and be beautiful. I know it doesn't matter, but it doesn't hurt.
author: Kirsten Dunst

text: My dad had this philosophy that if you tell children they're beautiful and wonderful then they believe it, and they will be. So I never thought I was unattractive. But I was never one of the girls at school who had lots of boyfriends.

text: O human beauty, what a dream art thou, that we should cast our life and hopes away on thee!
author: Barry Cornwall

text: When everything else physical and mental seems to diminish, the appreciation of beauty is on the increase.

text: I was not a good-lookin' girl. I was extremely skinny. I wasn't pretty. I wasn't cool.
